text.sentence: Energy | North America Oil and Gas: E and P seven August two thousand fifteen Stock Rating
Debt Concerns Increasing Â­ Investors Eager to Hear How CHK Will Address Debt and High Differentials
We believe operational results were strong but investors are becoming more concerned about weak prices and the high debt burden.
Reported results were above our expectations and CHK raised its two thousand fifteen production forecast while reiterating its capital budget.
CHK is actively pursuing asset sales, joint ventures and/or farm outs to improve its financial condition.
Chesapeake is also in discussions to modify its midstream contracts, which have resulted in wide differentials and weak realized prices.
Despite the challenges, CHK shares trade at over a twenty percent premium to peers.
We remain UW and are lowering our PT by dollar two to dollar five.
Chesapeake increased its two thousand fifteen production forecast while reiterating its budget.
CHK increased its production guidance by four percent while maintaining its dollar three.seven
CHK also guided to a two thousand fifteen exit rate that is nine percent higher than we had expected.
The company has a need to improve its balance sheet and provide drilling capital to exploit its large asset base.
It also needs capital to enter into transactions that would allow it to reduce the negative impact of above market infrastructure costs.
Executing on these plans could prove difficult given commodity price volatility and wide bid/ask spreads in the M and A market.
Chesapeake is in discussions with Williams to modify its existing midstream contracts and improve differentials.
CHK's midstream contracts include cost ofservice agreements and minimum volume commitments, both of which were inherited by current management.
The contracts have significantly widened the company's gas and NGL price differentials and depressed cash flow.
We believe CHK will outspend its un hedged cash flow by three fourx, while growing pro forma volumes five seven percent YoY.
Chesapeake trades at nine.twox our two thousand sixteen PICF estimates, a twenty percent premium to peers.
CHK is levered at over sixx net debt to forward EBITDA, compared to the two.fivex

We are Underweight CHK shares due to very low commodity price realizations driven by unfavorable contract arrangements and a challenging price environment.
We are concerned about the company's financial leverage and think CHK's ability to grow on pace with peers could be challenged if cash flows are strained.
Our upside case assumes a dollar ten/bbl increase in our mid cycle WTI estimate and dollar .fifty
Our downside case assumes a dollar ten/bbl reduction in our mid cycle WTI estimate and dollar .fifty

Income statement EBITDAX PICF EBIT Pre tax income Net income EPS Diluted shares DPS Margin and return data ROACE Revenues Cash opex Non cash opex EBITDAX margin EBIT margin Balance sheet and cash flow Shareholders' equity Net debt/ Capital employed Discretionary cash flow Capital expenditure Dividends paid Net cash surplus/ Valuation and leverage metrics P/E EV/EBITDAX EV/PICF Unallocated CF yield Dividend yield EV/oneP reserves EV/boe pd Net debt/EV Debt/cash flow Selected operating metrics BA cash flow growth BA production growth Oil production NGL production N.A. gas prod Total production Oil and liquids/total prod N.A. gas/total prod oneP reserves
CHK is actively pursuing asset sales, JVs and farm outs Chesapeake is actively pursuing asset sales, joint ventures and/or farm outs to raise cash and/or reduce capital.
The company has a need to improve its balance sheet and provide drilling capital to exploit its large asset base.
It also needs capital to enter into transactions that would allow it to reduce the negative impact of above market infrastructure costs.
We believe CHK is considering asset sales across the Utica, Haynesville, Powder River Basin and Mid Continent.
While we agree with the company's strategy, the execution of these plans could prove challenging given commodity price volatility and wide bid/ask spreads in the M and A market.
Chesapeake is in discussions with Williams to modify its existing midstream contracts, which have been debilitating to realized prices.
CHK has cost of service agreements across many of its plays and minimum volume commitments in the Haynesville and Barnett.
These midstream contracts, which were inherited by current management, have significantly widened the company's gas and NGL price differentials, creating very low realized prices.
CHK stated it is in positive discussions with Williams to restructure these contracts; the company anticipates differentials to remain flat independent of any modification.
Chesapeake increased its two thousand fifteen production forecast while reiterating its capital budget.
CHK increased its production guidance by four percent to six hundred seventy two mboepd while maintaining its dollar three.seven
The production increase would represent six percent proforma growth over last year.
CHK also guided to a six hundred sixty mboepd exit rate in two thousand fifteen, which implies a nine percent decrease in threeQ production followed by a three percent increase in fourQ.
Despite the momentum heading into two thousand sixteen, we still expect production to decline over two percent next year.

While CHK had positive twoQ results and has an organized plan to tackle debt and mitigate its midstream contracts, we believe the execution of this strategy could prove difficult in the current commodity price environment.
We still expect CHK to outspend its un hedged cash flow by three fourx, while growing pro forma volumes just five seven percent year over year.
NGL prices in twoQ, which is ninety one percent lower than this time last year.
five/mmBtu un hedged gas prices, which is seventy three percent lower YoY.
We believe Chesapeake will deliver subpar balance sheet adjusted growth of five percent in twenty million one hundred fifty two thousand sixteen.
Balance sheet adjusted growth compares economic equivalent production growth to expansion in market capital deployed.
We use this as a proxy for return on new capital, and have found it correlates well with share prices.
At five percent, we expect CHK to lag peers in BAPG by a sizable margin.
CHK shares trade at over a twenty percent premium to peers despite being the most highly levered name in our coverage.
CHK shares currently trade at premium to peers despite being the most highly levered name in our coverage.
The stock currently trades at nine.twox our forwardyear pre interest cash flow estimates, over a twenty percent premium to the group.
The company is levered at over sixx net debt to forward EBITDA, compared to the two.fivex
We remain UW and are lowering our PT by dollar two to dollar five.
CHK is in discussions to modify its midstream contracts, which have significantly lowered realized prices
CHK increased its two thousand fifteen production forecast while maintaining its budget
We remain UW and are lowering our PT to dollar five.
CHK posted earnings and cash flow above our estimates Chesapeake posted clean EPS of dollar, which was above our dollar estimate but in line with consensus.
CHK posted stronger production across the board, had stronger oil and gas realizations than expected, at dollar .seventy

Midstream net margin came in strong at dollar two hundred nine million versus our dollar million expectation; dollar forty eight million of the dollar two hundred nine million is considered recurring and the remaining dollar one hundred sixty one is non recurring, reported as a supply contract derivative.
Â· Net loss of dollar included the following one time items, net of tax: one) dollar three.six

hundred sixty six billion in impairments, two) dollar two hundred forty four million provisions for legal contingencies, three) dollar two hundred twenty million in unrealized losses on commodity derivatives, four) dollar one hundred sixty one million in gains on supply contract derivatives
FIGURE two Full year two thousand fifteen two thousand sixteen Estimates
Utica Shale Utica production was up thirteen percent sequentially in twoQ Utica production was one hundred twenty four mboepd during twoQ, which is thirteen percent higher than in oneQ.
Chesapeake curtailed one hundred gross mmcfpd of production in July and is currently curtailing two hundred seventy five gross mmcfpd due to low gas and NGL prices.

CHK expects to continue to curtail volumes until a new regional pipeline is in service in November, which will allow the company to move three hundred fifty gross mmcfpd out of the basin at a more competitive transportation rate.
The twoQ average completed well cost was dollar eight.five million with a lateral length of eight thousand feet and forty three frac stages.
This compares to the two thousand fourteen average completed well cost of dollar seven.two million with a lateral length of six thousand two hundred feet and twenty nine frac stages.
Utica well costs should continue to increase as CHK invests in longer laterals and larger completions.
The company continues to reject ethane to maximize gas price realizations.
Chesapeake operated four rigs in the Utica in twoQ, down from eight rigs a year ago.
CHK expects to maintain two rigs in the second half of two thousand fifteen.

Eagle Ford Eagle Ford production down seven percent lower due to a facility downtime Eagle Ford volumes were seven percent lower since last quarter due to a third party treating facility being down for sixty days.
Well costs were twelve percent lower in twoQ than in two thousand fourteen.
The average completed well cost was dollar five.two million with a lateral length of five thousand seven hundred feet and twenty frac stages.
This compares to two thousand fourteen when the well cost was dollar five.nine million with five thousand eight hundred fifty foot laterals and eighteen stages.
CHK has drilled six wells with over nine thousand foot laterals and is currently drilling one that is thirteen thousand feet.
The company operated six rigs in twoQ compared to twenty rigs a year ago.

Haynesville Shale and Bossier Shale CHK lowered its MVC expectation by dollar twenty million due to strong Haynesville production Haynesville production was six hundred sixty nine mmcfpd, up thirty two percent year over year and nine percent sequentially.
Due to strong production in this play, CHK has lowered its minimum volume commitment penalty expectation by dollar twenty million.
The average completed well cost was dollar seven.nine million with four thousand nine hundred foot laterals and thirteen frac stages.
This compares to a two thousand fourteen cost of dollar eight.four million with four thousand nine hundred foot laterals and fourteen stages.
CHK operated six rigs in twoQ, down from eight rigs a year ago.
Chesapeake expects to increase to seven rigs and maintain that level through year end.
Marcellus Shale Marcellus curtailments increased to five hundred gross mmcfpd Marcellus production was one percent lower sequentially at eight hundred twenty mmcfpd.
The company curtailed five hundred gross mmcfpd of production in twoQ compared to three hundred mmcfpd curtailed in oneQ.
The curtailments are due to weak pricing stemming from pipeline constraints, and they are expected to continue through year end.
The twoQ completed well cost was dollar seven.five million with a lateral length of six thousand nine hundred feet and twenty eight frac stages.
This compares to the two thousand fourteen average cost of dollar seven.five million with a lateral length of six thousand feet and twenty seven frac stages.
Utica well costs should increase with longer laterals and larger completions
Eagle Ford well costs were twelve percent lower in twoQ than in two thousand fourteen
Barclays | Chesapeake Energy Chesapeake operated one rig in the Marcellus, compared to six rigs this time last year.
Mid Continent Production in the Mississippi Lime was up one percent sequentially Production in the Mississippi Line was thirty two mboepd during twoQ, a one percent increase over oneQ.
The average completed well cost in twoQ was dollar two.eight million with lateral length of four thousand four hundred fifty feet and ten stages.
This compares to two thousand fourteen when the average completed well costs was dollar three. million with a lateral length of four thousand four hundred fifty feet and nine stages.
Recent well costs are dollar two.seven million as the company continues to realize efficiencies.
Chesapeake averaged four rigs in the second quarter, compared to eight rigs this time last year.
The company expects to maintain two rigs for the second half of the year.

Powder River Basin PRB cycle times have reduced forty percent and costs have declined twenty five percent in oneHfifteen vs. oneHfourteen Powder River Basin production was twenty mboepd during twoQ, up one percent quarter overquarter.
Average completed well cost was dollar eleven. million in twoQ with a lateral length of six thousand feet and twenty two stage.
This compares to two thousand fourteen when the well cost was dollar ten.six million with an average lateral length of five thousand four hundred feet and twenty frac stages.
Most recently, CHK completed well costs under dollar eight.seven million.
From the first half of two thousand fourteen to the first half of two thousand fifteen, cycle times have reduced by forty percent and costs by over twenty five percent .
CHK operated one rig in the second quarter, compared to three rigs a year ago.
The company is planning to maintain one rig through year end.
We are lowering our price target by dollar two to dollar five.
We are lowering our price target by dollar two to dollar five.
fivex multiple on our forward year hedge adjusted pre interest cash flow estimate to obtain an implied Enterprise Value .
The estimate for forward year PICF is based on a benchmark natural gas price forecast of dollar three.twenty
To calculate a target stock market value, we subtract projected year end two thousand fifteen net and year end FASone hundred forty three asset retirement obligation.
Our target EV is based on two thousand sixteen PICF before hedging impacts; and our price target treats estimated hedge gains/losses as a financial instrument .

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Guide to the Barclays Research Price Target: Each analyst has a single price target on the stocks that they cover.
The price target represents that analyst's expectation of where the stock will trade in the next twelve months.
Upside/downside scenarios, where provided, represent potential upside/potential downside to each analyst's price target over the same twelve month period.
Top Picks: Barclays Equity Research's Top Picks represent the single best alpha generating investment idea within each industry, taken from among the Overweight rated stocks within that industry.
Barclays Equity Research publishes global and regional Top Picks reports every quarter and analysts may also publish intra quarter changes to their Top Picks, as necessary.
While analysts may highlight other Overweight rated stocks in their published research in addition to their Top Pick, there can only be one Top Pick for each industry.
To view the current list of Top Picks, go to the Top Picks page on Barclays Live .

Valuation Methodology: Our price target of is derived by applying a multiple to our forward year pre interest cash flow estimate to calculate target Enterprise Value .
We have reduced EV to reflect FAS one hundred forty three asset retirement obligation and have also subtracted estimated YEtwo thousand fifteen net debt.
Our target EV is based on two thousand sixteen PICF before hedging impacts; and our target price treats estimated hedge gains/losses as a financial instrument .

Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Price Target: Materially different commodity prices, production levels, or leverage from our estimates would pose a risk to the achievement of our price target.
The company's production levels are impacted by a variety of factors including drilling success, reservoir performance and future acquisitions.
Our target price is based on a forward year firm value to delevered cash flow multiple.
